page.description: HTML content to wrap around the ViewBox Layout.

discussion.p: The *[ui:Wrapper HTML]* property defines the HTML content to wrap around the ViewBox.

description.p: The Wrapper HTML must include a div element with an attribute called *[html:a5-layout-target]* and the value of this attribute must be set to *[html:true]*. This is the div where the ViewBox layout will be injected
This property is shown when [Use wrapper] is enabled.

section.title: Example Wrapper: Adding a Fixed Header

description.p: You can add a fixed header to the ViewBox using the Wrapper HTML with some additional CSS. This example uses the AADemo-Northwind sample connection string to pull data from the Northwind Customer table. The CustomerID, CompanyName, Address, City, and Country fields are retrieved in the data source definition for the ViewBox.

The ViewBox's layout is shown below. Each field is placed in a Column LayoutContainer with a Column break after each field except the last one. The entire layout is wrapped in a ListRowContainer. The ListRowContainer styles each record shown in the ViewBox as a List row, which includes row highlighting on mouse hover and select.
The Wrapper HTML adds a fixed header to the ViewBox that doesn't scroll when the content is scrolled:

p.example:
Customer ID
Customer Name
Address
City
Country

description.p: This HTML uses two classes, *[css:header]* and *[css:headerLabel]*, which are locally defined CSS classes defined in the ViewBox CSS:
This CSS formats the header to be fixed on screen, preventing it from scrolling with the ViewBox. It also styles the header as bold text with a border along the bottom, as shown in the image below.

figure.title: The Wrapper HTML header for the ViewBox
figure.alt: The Wrapper HTML header for the ViewBox

description.p: Finally, a CSS class called *[css:margintop]* is defined and added to the ViewBox's *[ui:Class name]* property to add a margin. This margin is the same size as the height of the header defined in the Wrapper HTML. It adjusts the scrollbar on the right-hand side of the ViewBox contents to render below the header. Without this margin, the top of the scrollbar and the first row of data will render behind the header.
